snippet: The fact that Congress allowed counterterrorism laws to lapse is an extraordinary moment in the story of the tensions between post-9/11 policies and privacy rights.
abstract: News Analysis; interviews with intelligence experts suggest that there are several available workarounds as National Security Agency grapples with temporary expiration of Patriot Act provisions that allowed it to gather phone records en masse; key aspect is 'grandfather clause' that maintains powers for any investigation that was begun before June 1, 2015; records can also be obtained by grand jury subpoena if necessary.
lead_paragraph: The fact that Congress allowed counterterrorism laws to lapse is an extraordinary moment in the story of the tensions between post-9/11 policies and privacy rights.

headline.main: A Gap in Surveillance, but Ways Around It

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
